page.title: 02The Harbour, Whitby.
page.content: The fisherman usually go to sea after tea on Sunday.They collect their week's supply of ice and sail out to sea to catch: haddock, cod, sole, plaice, monkfish, catfish, dogfish, salmon, trout, lobster and whiting.Weekly catches are landed in wooden boxes on the fish quay to be sold on Wednesday and Friday mornings when the{fish market}is held. On the{Endeavour Wharf,}different cargoes are brought into and out of the dock.{Timber}from Norway,{steel} from Holland and Germany and{soya {beans}from Holland arrive regularly.{ {Scrap metal} and{steel coils}leave for Germany,{fertilizer}leaves for Belgium and{tin plate} is shipped to Holland.Cargoes are lifted by huge cranes.
